Elisor.definition: a judicial officer appointed to act in the stead of a sheriff when the sheriff and any other authorized official
Elisor.origin: [Anglo-French ellisour eslisour , literally, one who selects (jurors in the sheriff's stead), elector, from eslire to select, from Old French, ultimately from Latin eligere to choose, elect]

1.1: a judicial officer appointed to act in the stead of a sheriff when the sheriff and any other authorized official (as a coroner) are unable or unqualified to act
